Class Game

java.lang.Object
game.Game
public class Game extends Object
My main game entry point

  • Constructor Details

    • Game

      public Game()
      Initialise a new Game.

      Sets up the game level, sound manager, high score writer, camera, moving and shooting, and GUI components

  • Method Details

    • main

      public static void main(String[] args)
      Run the game.

    • goToNextLevel

      public void goToNextLevel()
      Handles the changing to a new level.

      Once a level is completed, this method is called and loads in the next level. Components like movement, shooting and camera are updated and score and time is carried over. This method also handles the game completion after level 3.

    • getLevel

      public GameLevel getLevel()
      Getter method to retrieve current level.

      This is used when other components or classes require access to the current level

      Returns:
      the current GameLevel instance.

    • getSoundManager

      public SoundManager getSoundManager()
      Getter method for the sound manager.

      Used when components and classes require access to the sound manager, for sounds and bgm.

      Returns:
      the SoundManager instance.

    • getHighScoreHandler

      public HighScoreWriter getHighScoreHandler()
      Getter method for the high score.

      Handles writing to and retrieving scores and times, from the file it is stored in. It is also used within ControlPanelForm for the high score panel.

      Returns:
      the HighScoreWriter instance.

    • gameOver

      public void gameOver()
      Handles the game over functions.

      Once a level 3 is completed, this method is called and loads in an input dialog to log the players name, score and final time.

    • getView

      public city.cs.engine.UserView getView()
      Getter method for the view.

      This is to give access to components and classes that require the view.

      Returns:
      the UserView instance.

    • setLevel

      public void setLevel(GameLevel level)
      Handles setting the level.

      This is used to load in a new level. It updates all components for the new level.

      Parameters:
      level - level to be started

    • getControlPanel

      public ControlPanelForm getControlPanel()
      Getter method for the control panel.

      Retrieves the control panel for the classes and components that require access to it.

      Returns:
      the ControlPanelForm instance.

    • pause

      public void pause()
      Handles pausing the level.

      This is used when the pause button is pressed. When called, it stops the current level.

    • resume

      public void resume()
      Handles resuming the level.

      This is used when the resume button is pressed. When called, it starts the current level again.

    • restart

      public void restart()
      Handles restarting the level.

      This is used mainly when the restart button is pressed so that the current level is reloaded and started again.

    • setRestart

      public void setRestart(boolean restart)
      Setter method for the restart variable.

      When called, it sets the boolean flag and indicates a restart.

      Parameters:
      restart - boolean value used to indicate a restart

    • isRestart

      public boolean isRestart()
      Getter method for the restart variable.

      Tracks whether the restart button is pressed (true) or not (false). This is used mainly within RestartButton

      Returns:
      the boolean restart variable.

    • getLevelStartTime

      public int getLevelStartTime()
      Getter method for accessing the time.

      This tracks the time the player starts at level 2 and 3, so that if they press the restart button at said levels, they start from the time they entered that level and not 0.

      Returns:
      the levelStartTime variable.

    • getOngoingScore

      public int getOngoingScore()
      Getter method for accessing the score.

      This tracks the score the player starts at level 2 and 3, so that if they press the restart button at said levels, they start from the score they entered that level and not 0.

      Returns:
      the levelScore variable.
